New Records: Blazers committed a season-worst 26 turnovers, leading to 36 points for the 76ers.
Key Match Events: The 76ers converted the Blazers' 26 turnovers into 36 points, a significant factor in their victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija started the game due to the injury of forward Jerami Grant.
Post-Match Reflections: Philadelphia 76ers center Joel Embiid scored a game-high 37 points and had a plus-minus of +26, second only to Philadelphia forward Caleb Martin.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blazers struggled from the three-point line, shooting 8-of-36 (22.2 percent). The 76ers' victory improves their record to 13-17, while the Blazers drop to 11-21.
